title: Andy Biggs
deleted: Biggs was a strong opponent of certifying the U.S. 2020 election results as a victory for Joe Biden. Prior to the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol]], organizer [[Ali Alexander]] stated that Biggs contributed to the planned organizing of a mob to pressure Congress into rejecting the election results; Biggs' office strongly denied any relationship to Alexander.<ref>https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/arizona/2021/01/10/paul-gosar-andy-biggs-credited-video-organizing-trump-crowd-dc/6603721002/</ref>

In December 2020, right-wing political activist and organizer Ali Alexander stated that Biggs was involved in the planning of organizing a mob to pressure Congress on January 6. These alleged plans resulted in the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol]]; according to Mr. Alexander, who defended the Capitol events as "completely peaceful", "It was to build momentum and pressure and then on the day change hearts and minds of Congress peoples who weren't yet decided or who saw everyone outside and said, 'I can't be on the other side of that mob."  After the events at the Capitol, Biggs responded with a statement denying any relationship between himself and Mr. Alexander. According to the spokesman, "Congressman Biggs is not aware of hearing of or meeting Mr. Alexander at any point — let alone working with him to organize some part of a planned protest." <ref>https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/08/us/online-extremism-inauguration-capitol-invs/index.html</ref><ref>https://www.thedailybeast.com/stop-the-steal-organizer-in-hiding-after-denying-blame-for-riot</ref><ref>https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/arizona/2021/01/10/paul-gosar-andy-biggs-credited-video-organizing-trump-crowd-dc/6603721002/</ref>

title: Andy Biggs
added: ===2021 storming of the United States Capitol===

title: Andy Biggs
added: Enabled by a $10 million sweepstakes winnings, which made him financially independent, Biggs decided to run for office. <ref>https://www.phoenixnewtimes.com/news/andy-biggs-the-10-million-chairman-and-his-tuesday-night-massacre-6503036</ref>

title: Andy Biggs
added: ===Election contesting and 2021 storming of the Capitol===

In 2020, Biggs joined fellow Arizona Representative [[Paul Gosar]] in a video claiming that there was [[2020_United_States_presidential_election#Trump's_potential_rejection_of_election_results|widespread voter fraud in the 2020 presidential election]]. They claimed that voting machines were faulty in Arizona, and Biggs claimed that poll-watchers were allowed to participate in vote tabulations in Detroit. They also demanded an audit of [[Maricopa County, Arizona|Maricopa County]]'s vote count.<ref name="Hansen">{{cite news |last1=Hansen |first1=Ronald J. |title=FACT CHECK: Reps. Andy Biggs, Paul Gosar still touting baseless election-fraud claims |url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/fact-check/2020/11/17/andy-biggs-paul-gosar-still-touting-baseless-election-fraud-claims/6334872002/ |access-date=20 November 2020 |work=The Arizona Republic |date=17 November 2020}}</ref> Later, Biggs falsely claimed that 10,000 voters were "disenfranchised" in Maricopa County, and did not provide evidence.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Dana |first1=Joe |title=US Rep. Andy Biggs falsely claims 10,000 voters were 'disenfranchised' |url=https://www.12news.com/article/news/politics/elections/congressman-andy-biggs-falsely-claims-10000-voters-disenfranchised/75-07c30754-b9c4-4fe9-9ef2-04e803b47ace |access-date=20 November 2020 |work=12news |date=13 November 2020}}</ref> In December 2020, Biggs was among 126 House Republicans who signed on to the amicus brief ''[[Texas v. Pennsylvania]]'', an unsuccessful lawsuit that asked the [[Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court]] to overturn election results from Georgia, Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin, thereby denying [[Joe Biden]] from taking office as president.<ref name"buzzfeed126"="">{{cite web |title=Here Are The Names Of 126 Members Of The House Who Refuse To Accept That Biden Won |url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/skbaer/list-republican-house-members-overturn-election |website=BuzzFeed News |access-date=12 December 2020 |date=11 December 2020}}</ref><ref name="TXvPAdocket">{{cite web |title=Motion for Leave to File Brief Amicus Curiae |url=https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/22/22O155/163550/20201211132250339_Texas%20v.%20Pennsylvania%20Amicus%20Brief%20of%20126%20Representatives%20--%20corrected.pdf |website=SupremeCourt.gov |access-date=12 December 2020 |date=10 December 2020}}</ref>

During the storming of the Capitol on January 6, 2021, Biggs, along with many congressional colleagues, was ushered to a secure location. Later, a video of Biggs surfaced in which he [[Face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States|refused to wear a mask]] in violation of House rules.<ref>https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/09/politics/republican-congress-members-refuse-masks-trnd/index.html?utm_source=twCNN&utm_medium=social&utm_term=link&utm_content=2021-01-11T00%3A15%3A06</ref><ref> https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/01/10/lawmakers-may-have-been-exposed-coronavirus-capitol-lockdown-attending-physician-says/ </ref> Within 24 hours, three House Democrats tested positive for [[COVID-19]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=FREKING|first=KEVIN|title=3 House Democrats test positive for COVID-19; Jayapal blames GOP members who refused to ‘wear a damn mask’ during Capitol lockdown|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/coronavirus/ct-nw-capitol-lockdown-congress-covid19-20210112-jpd2xiawzje6xarz7loixdp67m-story.html|access-date=2021-01-21|website=chicagotribune.com}}</ref>

On January 12, 2021, Biggs called on fellow GOP representative [[Liz Cheney]] to resign from her leadership position within the Republican caucus, after she voted in favor of Donald Trump's [[Second impeachment of Donald Trump|second impeachment]].<ref>https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/politics/freedom-caucus-liz-cheney-resign-impeachment</ref>

In the aftermath of the events on January 6, William Biggs and Daniel Biggs who are brothers of Andy, wrote a letter to the editor of the [[Arizona Republic]] demanding their brother‘s removal from office. They wrote that Biggs is “at least partially to blame” for the deadly riots. They also condemned his refusal to wear a mask in the secure location. According to the brothers, this "was a passive-aggressive tantrum and the ultimate disrespect for all present."<ref> https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/arizona/2021/01/20/rep-andy-biggs-brothers-andy-spread-election-fraud-lies/4235799001/ </ref>
